file_content.text: Go, little hunter! Make glory for Nem'ro!
You have my token and recognition as the most fearsome hunter on Hutta.
Indeed, you have proven yourself worthy of the Great Hunt. But the competition is only beginning.
From here you must go to Dromund Kaas--the Imperial capital. These are your shuttle passes.
I wish Braden could see this. At least now we can make his killer pay.
Winning the Great Hunt is my top priority. Revenge comes second.
First things first.
The way I see it, they're the same thing.
Tarro Blood will get what's coming to him--that's a promise.
You bet we will.
You're the best.
Get over it, girl. Braden's dead and we're not.
Enough about Braden.
I'll get over it--when Tarro Blood is dead.
When you arrive on Dromund Kaas, seek the Huntmaster in the Mandalorian enclave. He will answer all your questions about the Great Hunt.
You with me, Mako?
Let's go then.
All the way.
Catch you boys later.
To Dromund Kaas!
You've been a real big help, creepy guy.
Thanks, bone face.
Indeed.
I assume we'll see you later?
Nice meeting you, Grataa.
You may count on it, hunter.
Yes, go to the Great Hunt and spread the glory of Nem'ro the Hutt!
You and I aren't finished, Hutt. I'll be back.
This isn't over, Nem'ro.
As long as I get off this miserable planet, I'm happy.
Whatever it takes.
Be quiet for once, will you?
Shut up, Nem'ro.
Good hunting.
Very well, Nem'ro. When the Trandoshan returns I shall... ah, I see we have a new player in the game after all.
That's the bone-masked creep that followed me. Get him!
Ha! Little Mako--so fiery!
Hunter, allow me to apologize if I spooked your young friend.
Calm down a sec. Let's see what's what.
Hold on, Mako....
I regret that I startled you, young woman. I was pursuing another quarry when we crossed paths.
Talk fast.
Go ahead. I already filled my quota of killings today.
I'm all killed out anyway.
So it would seem.
I see my scaly friend Rarsk was no match for you, little hunter.
I am Grataa. It is my honor to represent the Great Hunt. I have been investigating possible malfeasance by one Tarro Blood.
He slaughtered my crew to keep me out of the Great Hunt.
Tarro is cheating.
Yes, I am aware. I regret that I arrived too late to intervene.
You buying any of this?
Mako, what do you think?
Yeah, it all makes sense. It's just rotten luck he didn't catch Tarro Blood in the act.
I reviewed your security holorecording and witnessed the murder of your teammates by Tarro's men.
While dishonorable, the attack wasn't technically against the rules. Unless Tarro attacks another competitor, he cannot be punished.
Tarro's too big a coward to take me on.
He's too scared to do that.
Be cautious accusing Mandalorians of cowardice. They do not take such insults lightly.
Nothing will stop me from getting revenge.
I'll punish him anyway.
Blast your stupid rules!
As you wish--but know that Tarro is protected by this competition's rules the same as you.
I shall continue to closely monitor Tarro Blood's activities. If he breaks the Great Hunt's rules, he will pay for it.
I want to know about the Great Hunt.
Forget about Tarro.
Does that mean you run the Great Hunt?
You're an official?
No, that honor belongs to another. I merely observe and help where I can.
I have remained here to give the Trandoshan, Rarsk, instructions for the Great Hunt. It seems this is no longer necessary.
Rarsk is dead. I have the token to prove it.
Got that right.
And thus, my instructions are now for you.
Whatever you were going to tell Rarsk, you can tell me instead.
They're my instructions, now.
As you say.
This Hutt tried to give my sponsorship to that walking lizard.
Nem'ro cheated me.
Stop whining!
You want the sponsorship? Go and get it!
A representative of the Great Hunt will be here shortly.
When he arrives, you would merely have to hand him my sponsorship token to enter the Great Hunt.
Unfortunately... I already gave the Great Hunt sponsorship token to someone else.
Cheating me was a bad idea, Nem'ro.
You double-crossing scum!
Now, now, Nem'ro is no cheat--he keeps his deals.
Who got your sponsorship, Nem'ro?
To whom?
Oh, now, that would make it too easy, wouldn't it?
I did all that work for nothing?
My time has been wasted.
You made good credits and had fun being a killer.
The sponsorship is just a token, a small holo with my authorization given to its bearer.
Someone fierce and deadly on Hutta has the sponsorship token. If you want it so badly, find him and take it! Ha!
I'll be back to deal with you, Hutt.
We're not done.
Don't think I won't do exactly that.
Laugh it up, you worm.
You're underestimating me again. Could be a fatal mistake.
You think I can't?
Yes, yes. If you succeed, I win. If you fail, I still win. Either way, the toughest man on Hutta goes to the Great Hunt with my name!
See Juda for compensation regarding that whole beastmaster business.
Come back here, present the token to the representative, and you can go to your Great Hunt!
Mighty hunter! You killed terrible beasts from Hutta and beyond--and the beastmaster, too!
Deception was the only way I could eliminate my beastmaster without upsetting things here.
I played your game--give me my sponsorship.
Sponsor me. Now.
I am going to kill you, Nem'ro!
You're dead.
You're welcome to try, but you may have other things on your mind.
That was the most fun I've had on this planet!
Actually, I enjoyed myself.
I am glad you enjoyed yourself, little bounty hunter. You may not enjoy this so much.
I did not expect you to survive the beast pits. Carnus said you would prevail, but--
I hear about little hunter kill spree in Rust Yards!
Yes, I should have listened to you, my friend. Now, what's done is done.
Don't make me guess. Just tell me.
I'm not in the mood for games.
No more excuses. I want into the Great Hunt, Nem'ro.
Give. Me. Sponsorship.
Put up or shut up, you fat lump.
Just spit it out.
Go, find the beastmaster and deal with him!
I have one more simple task for you. Something I need an outsider for.
The target is in my house, and I don't want word to reach him prematurely.
Give me a name and I'll get it done quietly.
Understood.
After I do this, I'm in the Great Hunt. That's the deal.
This is the last job, right?
Of course, of course. It must be done quickly.
I'll solve your problem. Might get messy, though.
I do like killing.
The traitor in my house is my own beastmaster. He plots against me and thinks I do not know.
Go to the beast pits and pull the alarm switch. When the beastmaster comes, kill him.
This better be on the level, Nem'ro.
Don't cross me.
You don't trust me, little bounty hunter?
All right, I'm going.
What about the credits from my last job?
I still haven't been paid.
Fight for me and get many credits!
Now, go kill that traitor of a beastmaster!
There she is!
There he is!
My spies say Yalt's wife left town as if all the akk dogs on Hutta were after her.
I also saw that you crashed Fa'athra's accounts. Above and beyond, bounty hunter. Truly powerful.
A truly prodigious warrior. So fierce of spirit!
Put me in the Great Hunt, Nem'ro.
Then sponsor me.
Soon, soon, my impatient bounty hunter.
I'll destroy anything you put in front of me.
You name it, I kill it.
I will let you prove that boast!
I love you, too, Nem'ro. Really.
Right back at you.
Hoho. I am far too much for you, little woman.
Good, good. It is proper to adore your master.
There is a Rodian in the hall that wants to talk to you.
You have Yalt head? Yalt head for wife at cantina! You so dumb.
Yalt still alive. Maybe better you don't disturb Nem'ro.
How much do you know of what is happening here on Hutta?
I know there's been a lot of shooting.
Haven't paid much attention.
Looks like a turf war between you and another Hutt.
A gang battle?
Let's pretend I don't know very much.
Enlighten me.
The upstart Fa'athra lays claim to things that are mine. He moves against my factories, sends his scum to make trouble in Jiguuna.
Some fools think Fa'athra is becoming a stronger Hutt than Nem'ro. One is Yalt, my ex-accountant.
Yalt now works for Fa'athra at the factory in the Rust Yards. The accountant must die for his betrayal.
Anything else I should know before I head out?
That it?
You want his head, right? Maybe on your floor?
I know where this is going.
You know me so well. But the head is not for me.
You're kind of a one-solution Hutt.
No second chances, huh?
I like things simple.
After the accountant Yalt is dead, take his head to the cantina.
Yalt's wife works there. She encouraged his disloyalty to me. Give Yalt's head to her.
Harassing people isn't usually my line of work.
That's not what I do.
If you're going to the Great Hunt, you must be willing to do anything, little girl.
If you're going to the Great Hunt, you must be willing to do anything, little bounty hunter.
You're my kind of sick, Nem'ro.
This is going to be great.
All right.
Fa'athra protects Yalt behind a blast-proof security door, but someone smart like you will find a way in.
Go--show Yalt what it means to cross Nem'ro!
See Juda when you want credits. She pay you for dead savage!
My little bounty hunter returns!
She smell like dead savage!
He smell like dead savage!
Then it's true. You killed the famed Huttsbane. Tell me of your hunt.
You asked for a head. I went and got it.
Left. Killed. Returned.
So simple, was it? One time might be luck....
I danced in savage blood.
I had a blast.
Who's more savage? The savage or the savage-killer?
Uh... wait, I know this one....
Shut up, Carnus.
Huttsbane was a noble and brave warrior.
He was a worthy target.
Yet he died when you stuck a blaster in his face. That's what "noble" gets you.
Your next target will not be so easy to reach, though he shouldn't put up much of a fight when you find him.
You come back with bad Evocii head. Then, you talk to Nem'ro.
Look, boss--little woman come to beg for mighty Nem'ro's attention.
Look, boss--little tiny man come to beg for mighty Nem'ro's attention.
Be polite, Carnus. This bounty hunter has been sweeping the filth from my town's lovely streets.
Excuse him, he lacks manners. You stand in the court of Nem'ro. All you see in Jiguuna is under my authority. Welcome.
Thanks.
Now that we've got pleasantries out of the way, let's talk business.
Thanks.
Ha! Straight to the point, is it? Then I will do you the same favor.
It's a rare pleasure.
I am honored to be in your presence, great Hutt.
Of course you are.
Some citizens here need more respect for your authority.
Rough town.
Troublemakers. They are no threat to me. Let us talk about you.
Lovely little Mako called to explain your situation, so let's cut right to the chase.
You want sponsorship into the Great Hunt. I can provide that. But why should I?
I will bring great fame to you.
Because I can win.
My teammate and mentor were murdered.
For revenge.
Ah yes, I heard about that. Nasty business, but not my concern.
You don't want me as an enemy, Nem'ro.
So you don't make me mad.
Hoho! We've got a little spitfire here.
Hoho! We've got a little man who thinks he's a Mandalorian!
Mako says you are a famous bounty hunter--that hardened men run and hide just hearing your name. But Mako says lots of things.
Mako may have exaggerated the odd detail.
It's mostly true.
An honest bounty hunter? What next? A funny Jedi?
Mako said you're a powerful Hutt, Nem'ro. Was that a lie?
You calling her a liar?
A good liar always sprinkles some truth among the fabrications.
I can handle anything you throw at me, you overgrown slug.
Then test me, creep.
You're lucky I'm in a good mood, little bounty hunter.
You want to prove that you are this fearsome manhunter? I will give you that chance.
I have targets here on wonderful Hutta that need eliminating. No problem for one with your reported skills.
I do this and you get me into the Great Hunt, right?
And then I'm sponsored?
You do these things to please me. The more pleased I am, the more generous I become.
Name them, and they're dead.
Done.
That easy, is it? We will see.
Let's talk credits.
You don't dictate terms to me--but do not worry, I honor my debts.
The first head you will bring me is that of an Evocii--one of those useless, sniveling natives.
You don't have a soft spot for primitive tribesmen, do you?
If there's money in it, I'll take any target.
My soft spot is for credits.
A true mercenary. You'll do well with Nem'ro.
I don't think you honestly care.
Would it matter?
Exactly right. You want into the Great Hunt? You do as I say.
Skip the quiz.
Watch how you talk at Nem'ro!
The Evocii sold us this world for trinkets. Now they take up arms against their rightful masters. It's disgusting.
One Evocii dares call himself Huttsbane. He raids my holdings and hides in a swamp village. Place his head on my floor.
Head on floor. Got it.
Done.
Don't even think about double-crossing me, Nem'ro.
This better be on the level.
I could bring in Huttsbane alive. A nice prisoner to show off?
Do I have to kill him?
Women should not be bounty hunters. Women soft.
Little man is not a bounty hunter. Little man soft.
No prisoners! Bring me a head, or don't come back!
Kill Huttsbane's followers, too--but leave their heads in the village. Go now.
Be careful, little bounty hunter. Huttsbane once blasted into other palace. Killed pile of captains--murdered a mighty Hutt!
I'll take it under consideration.
Consider me warned.
I guess that explains the "Huttsbane" part.
Sounds about right.
You must have me confused with a coward.
Don't try to scare me.
Ha! I make bet with gamblers that you die.
Nem'ro not expecting you. Go away, little worm.
I am busy, little hunter.
